snippet: The Supreme Court considered a request by Missouri prosecutors and the federal government to rule that warrants are not needed to obtain blood samples in drunken-driving cases.
abstract: Supreme Court considers request by Missouri prosecutors and federal government to rule that warrants are not needed to obtain blood samples in drunken-driving cases.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court considered a request by Missouri prosecutors and the federal government to rule that warrants are not needed to obtain blood samples in drunken-driving cases.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Weighs Drunken-Driving Blood Tests
headline.main: Justices Look at Legality of Drunken-Driving Test
headline.print_headline: Justices Look at Legality Of Drunken-Driving Test
